newsitem.title: USA: Summit Medical to delay 10-K filing.
newsitem.headline: Summit Medical to delay 10-K filing.

text.p: Summit Medical Systems Inc said Monday it would delay filing its Form 10-K until no later than April 4 in order to finalize a previously-announced downwards restatement of earlier results.
At the start of March, Summit Medical disclosed the need to revise its financial statements for 1994, 1995 and 1996, after discovering several issues related to revenue recognition.
Summit said it was also delaying the Form 10-K filing to allow independent auditors Ernst & Young LLP complete its 1996 audit of the company.

The company said it continued to believe that revenue for the years 1996, 1995 and 1994 was overstated in total by $4 million to $6 million, or eight to 12 percent of total revenue for the three-year period.
Summit Medical provides management systems and information services for the healthcare industry.
